info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 17 at 1:16AM CDT until August 17 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS La Crosse WI
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Iowa, including the following county, Allamakee.
* WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 114 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waukon, Lansing, Harpers Ferry, De Soto, Churchtown, Elon, State Road 9 And County X 20, Red Barn Campground, Village Creek, Dalby, County Roads A 26 And X 6 A, Thompson Corner, Eldergrove, Hanover, Dorchester, County Roads A 52 And X 52, Andy Mountain Campground and Lock And Dam 9. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING
